fields.summary: FIXED (SEE COMMENTS IN CASE SOMEONE ELSE HAS THIS ISSUE) Issues with upgrading in places from 4.3x to 4.4...if we cant get this fixed asap, we will need to roll back

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25330].
  {panel}

[Setting Up a SQL Server 2005 database for JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Up+a+SQL+Server+2005+database+for+JIRA] provides step by step instruction on how to configure db server with schema called _jiraschema_. Where [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2005|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2005#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2005-2.CreateandConfiguretheSQLServerDatabase] & [Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-2.CreateandConfiguretheSQLServerDatabaserefers] to a schema called _dbo_.

Also when running ./config.sh the SQL Server configuration will default a schema to dbo, this makes me think that it should be what is the recommended schema, but it may be best to discuss with a developer just to check exactly what should be the recommended schema, weather it be dbo or jiraschema.

Within this documantation:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Up+a+SQL+Server+2005+database+for+JIRA
If it's dbo then this schema is already created and the schema need only be associated with the DB user and permissions need to be assigned to that user.
if it's jiraschema then this documentation can stay the same and it will need to be changed elsewhere.

_Note_ this change was introduced in doco for JIRA 4.4.

This inconsistency is likely to cause unnecessary confusion for less experienced db admins who in fact were are trying to help in here :)
fields.summary: inconsistent naming convenience for db schema

fields.description:
JIRA 4.4 MSSQL schema in dbconfig.xml does not get picked up by ./config.sh

*Steps:*
* I first configured database properties using ./config.sh fully with schema, DB name, user etc... 
* Checked my dbconfig.xml file to see if it worked
* Run ./config.sh again and note that the schema does not come up though the rest of the config is there, and still in dbconfig.xml

See screenshot.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.4 MSSQL schema in dbconfig.xml does not get picked up by ./config.sh
Add keyboard shortcut for "assign to me"

fields.description:
The columns in the Time Since gadget are not clickable in Internet Explorer 8. Compatibility Mode doesn't help.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Time Since gadget (mine is filter-based).
# Use Firefox to view the dashboard. Note that the columns show Hand cursor and are clickable.
# View in IE8. Columns show Pointer cursor and are not clickable.
# Toggle IE8's Compatibility mode and note that it doesn't affect the problem
fields.summary: Time Since gadget not clickable in IE8

fields.description:
We would like to have a custom field where it can be filled with information gathered from external sources (XML, SQL query etc.)

We realised that there is a plugin ([JIRA Database Values Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/4969]) which performs this functionality, but it is not supported by Atlassian. Is there any way to integrate this feature in future releases of JIRA?
fields.summary: Possibility to have a New Custom Field where Values are Gathered from External Sources (XML, SQL query etc)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25325].
  {panel}

Hi,

A customer just noticed the following behavior on JIRA 4.4

# Create a new Project in Administration.
# View the project Summary.
# Click Issue Types tab.
# Click pencil button to Change Scheme.
# Make a selection and Save.
# You are taken to the Issue Types administration screen.

You should actually be taken back to the Project screen.

Regards,
Ruchi
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Updating a change to the Issue Type Scheme for a Project returns to the Issue Type screen instead of the Project screen

fields.description:
The XML View produce by JIRA does not follow the expected result as describe [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA042/Displaying+Search+Results+in+XML]. This is tested and reproduceable in JIRA 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4. 

Steps to replicate:
# create versions in a project
# create one Version Picker type custom field
# create one issue and choose any value in the Version Picker type custom field
# filter issue in Issue Navigator and choose the View XML. It will display the result for the custom field:
{noformat}
<customfields>
	<customfield id="customfield_10000" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:version">
	<customfieldname>versionpicker</customfieldname>
	<customfieldvalues><customfieldvalue>10000</customfieldvalue></customfieldvalues>
	</customfield>
</customfields>
{noformat}
fields.summary: XML View Display Version As ID Instead of Version Name
Provide "tag wiki" features to add description and redirection to tag

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a filter with its own custom display columns in the issue navigator. 
!screenshot-1.jpg!
# Export to Excel (current fields)
# As expected the issue will be exported with same number and order of columns as shown in the *filterwithcustomcolumns.xls* 
# Now switch the view of the filter to use the default columns in the issue navigator. We will naturally expect that the exported filter should display all the default columns but we will rather get same result where only the filter columns are exported. See *filterwithdefaultcolumns.xls*
!screenshot-2.jpg!
fields.summary: User's default issue navigator columns ignored when exporting current fields to Excel

fields.description: Ironically the root cause of this is the AO plugin it seems. See attached logs
fields.summary: Can't find oracle-jdbc14 building JIRA 4.4 from the source

fields.description:
Building JIRA 4.4 from the source it has a transitive dependency on infinitydb which is not available publicly since its a proprietary library used by FishEye. Looking at the logs attached this comes from the {{com.atlassian.support:stp}} plugin. 

A good fix would be to get said plugin to depend on FishEye's API instead (I believe it has one) or at least put an exclusion on the {{fisheye-jar}} for infinitydb:

{code:xml}
  <exclusion>
    <groupId>com.boilerbay.infinitydb</groupId>
    <artifactId>infinitydb</artifactId>
  </exclusion>
{code}

*Note:* this is also a good *workaround* for anyone trying to build JIRA 4.4's from source.
fields.summary: Fix source distribution plan so that a source distribution build is tested correctly.

fields.description:
Steps to replicate the problem:
* Set the 'linked issues' to be *required* from Field Configurations
* Put the 'linked issues' in Create Issues screen
* Create an issues and leave the 'link issues' field to be empty. 

From the 'linked issues' field description:
bq."If you leave it blank, no link will be made"

It should be validated the create issues while the issue is not linked properly.
fields.summary: "Linked Issues" field does not work properly when set to be a required field

fields.description:
I want to search across a JIRA instance, for textual references to JIRA keys that are in another JIRA instance.

If I search on the following:
* FE-3626
* 3626

I get no results, and the following message:

{quote}
Issue Does Not Exist

The issue you are trying to view does not exist.

If you think this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions.
{quote}

If there are no matching JIRAs, then I would like JIRA to resort to the following JQL:

{code}text ~ "FE-3626"{code}
fields.summary: Searching for issue-like keys, returns 0 results. e.g. FE-3626 or 3626

fields.description:
this library has restricted license - cannot be used for military use. We don't want JIRA to have such limitation.
By decision of Scott, JML and Paul we are to replace it with a library which does not have such license restrictions.

Update: we have a written permission from mindprod CSV parser author to use it in JIRA without inheriting the license limitations (no-military use only would not apply then).
We are talking to a customer whose legal department expressed some doubts about it. If the situation is fully clarified, we may end up restoring CSV mindprod back to JIRA.
fields.summary: Remove dependency on mindprod CSV parser

fields.description: Many people in our team don't know how to config a gadget to track issues. So if jira can copy gadget, it will reduce many people's cost of learning JIRA. This is very essential in a large company to reduce such huge people's cost and increase their efficiency.
fields.summary: JIRA can support to copy gadget to other dashboard.

fields.description:
* Create a security scheme 
* Add security levels with no description
* associate a project with this scheme.
* View the Issue Security Project Tab
http://localhost:8090/jira/plugins/servlet/project-config/MKY/issuesecurity

RESULT: Description is listed as "$issueSecurity.description"
Expected: Blank

Note that I am running Oracle, so this could be related to the Oracle NULL/empty String problem.
fields.summary: Bad handling of null in Issue Security Levels.

fields.description:
The project panel "Versions" displays a list of versions for that project, plus their description and release dates.
The attached screenshot shows that the version name is wrapped at 150px width, which seems unnecessary given all the space available to the right.

The width is hard-coded to 150px in versions-panel.vm. Changing it to 400px solved this for one client. An alternative would be to use the CSS ellipsis seen in other parts of JIRA. Note that wrapping doesn't seem to happen in non-IE8 browsers.
fields.summary: Version name is wrapped unnecessarily in project panel "Versions"

When requesting a new password in JIRA 4.4 using the german translation, the following incorrect text is displayed:

Eine Verknüpfung zum Zurücksetzen des Passworts wurde Ihnen per E-Mail zugestellt.
Sie können diese Verknüpfung öffnen und ein neues Passwort auswählen.
Wenn es nicht ankommt, wenden Sie sich an einen der please contact your JIRA administratorsAdministratoren{1}.
fields.summary: incorrect text in reset password dialog

fields.description:
This may be a duplicate of [JRA-12984|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12984] but I'm raising it separately just in case it isn't. 

When a user with Modify Reporter permissions uses a stored CreateIssueDetails link with default field values to create a new issue, we see the following behaviour:
# if reporter is set in URL - create issue screen has reporter field set to specified person - good
# if reporter is not set in URL - create issue screen has reporter field blank - bad
(Example of CreateIssueDetails URL: 
http://product-jira.ciena.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10031&issuetype=13&customfield_10017=3&customfield_10116=203)

The Create Issue screen you get from using a CreateIssueDetails link should behave the same as the Create Issue screen you get from clicking on Create Issue - the reporter field should default to the current user if not specified in the URL.
fields.summary: CreateIssueDetails URL does not fill in default value for Reporter field when user has Modify Reporter permissions

fields.description:
This bug only appears in gadgets running on a different server, e.g. JIRA gadget embedded in Confluence page.

Ajax GET request with data object p, where
p.abc = undefined;

Works fine when running gadget locally (thus the param abc is ignored), but when proxying the ajax request through the server, the generated target url contains <url>?abc=undefined. Breaks rest resources that specifically expect certain parameters.

Hard to debug and only noticeable when gadget is run remotely.
fields.summary: "undefined" ajax url parameter incorrectly serialized when proxying remote gadget ajax requests

fields.description:
When setting "remaining work to 0" as a Post Function in a Workflow, if work is logged in the last transition only, both the Original and Remaining estimates are set to zero.  If other work has been logged beforehand, the error does not occur. The discussion (with about a dozen screenshots and a full backup) is available here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-87009

The work-around for them was to move the post function farther down in the series of post functions.  Is this intended behavior?
fields.summary: "Set remaining to 0" post function resets Estimated Time and Remaining Time when closing ticket and logging work.

fields.description:
The definition of RemoteWorklogImpl is no longer in the WSDL. The getWorklogs method returns this internal object and not RemoteWorklog itself. Therefore, a proxy built with the WSDL returned by JIRA 4.4 works with neither this JIRA version nor the previous ones.

Workaround: save the new WSDL from JIRA (to use the new methods) and copy the definition manually into it from an old WSDL:

<schema targetNamespace="http://service.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
     <import namespace="http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2"/>
     <import namespace="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com"/>
     <import namespace="http://exception.rpc.jira.atlassian.com"/>
     <import namespace="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
     <complexType name="RemoteWorklogImpl">
       <complexContent>
         <extension base="tns1:RemoteWorklog">
           <sequence/>
         </extension>
       </complexContent>
     </complexType>
   </schema>
fields.summary: RemoteWorklogImpl is missing from the WSDL, whereas it is returned by getWorklogs

fields.description:
I work as a lone programmer inside an architecture firm and I handle new feature requests for our applications from employees inside the company.  A lot of the time I end up having to wait for my 'client' (aka another employee at the firm) or the other IT guys before I can complete an issue.  This is usually because I'm requesting information or maybe a resource.  For example I may be waiting for IT to set me up a new web server or for one of my 'clients' to give me information for finishing a report.

Right now, to track this information, I make a comment on the issue about what the question is about and who I'm asking it to.  This way if I not working on an issue for a while because of a request I can come back and check when I last requested the information and also fill in the answers if they responded.

What would be nice is to have built in logic for storing requests related to an issue and also a notification system where it tells me about the requests that have not been responded to in an adequate amount of time.  That way I can contact the person whom I am requesting the information from if they forgot about the request.
fields.summary: Request for Information System

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25277].
  {panel}

On upgrade Installer detects modification detection to {{atlassian-jira}}. In JIRA Tomcat's configuration files such as {{server.xml}} are excluded from the check. Moreover, users are not provided with any warning or feedback from Installer requesting them to manually migrate any changes from used {{server.xml}} across to its equivalent in JIRA.

Significant number of our customers modify {{server.xml}} to provide HTTPS or AJP and some of them are likely to miss our warning in the upgrade guide. Therefore installer should help them avoid this 'simile' configuration problem in order to streamline their upgrade process.

Originally reported issue below:
{quote}
_Automated upgrade, when using the installer, erases SSL and IIS configurations_

Hey guys,

So, on the new 4.4 JIRA, when you install it using the installer, you are promtped to upgrade an existing install. If this install is working already with SSL or IIS, after the upgrade is done, all these working confugurations stopped working.

So, steps to reproduce:
- make a JIRA pre 4.4 use SSL or IIS
- upgrade this existing install via Windows installer
- try to access JIRA

Any updates on this would be great!

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
{quote}
fields.summary: On upgrade Installer needs to migrate content of server.xml  or warn users

fields.description:
I was disappointed to find that Jira does not have a Currency field type and that the only option is to write a plugin.  I didn't find any on the plugin exchange.

How about this:

When you add a custom number field, Jira could give me a place to put a custom display format (e.g. $x,xx0.00) and then the view issue screen would show in that format.  I know I can edit the Velocity template for number display, but I have only a couple of currency fields, and the other number fields are just regular numbers.  I need per-field control.  I bet this would be popular.  See for example:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/5111/how-to-format-number-field-to-dollar-amount

Just asked this week.
fields.summary: Ability to provide a number format string for each custom number field

fields.description:
Some strange behavior of JIRA Advanced Mail Handler.

I migrated old JIRA to new instance. Then set up settings. There are exist Pop services on several projects in the JIRA services. They create issues from emails for existing projects. It was an introduction. :-)

Now i talk about error.
All Pop services have the bulk parameter set to "forward". Forwarding email is set. But it turn out, that forwarding email accaunt was disabled or deleted. So, MS Exchange returned email to the sender. Sender is a JIRA Pop service for some existing project. This service got rejected message and processed it. Service tried to create issue. Then tried to forward message to forwarding email. Exchange rejected the message again. So, after 1 day we bacome 22 thousands sendings of email. Admin mailbox was overfilled.

I think, JIRA Advanced Mail Handler should not get rejected email. Especially it should not try to process rejected messages.
fields.summary: Strange behavior of JIRA Advanced Mail Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25250].
  {panel}

I've been toying around with ideas for the JIRA menu bar to improve some minor problems with it:

* the disabled "More Actions" and "Workflow" buttons are unnecessary when additional actions or workflow aren't present
* the "More" button labels are the only way the user can tell which button group relates to which functionality: actions or workflow.

Therefore, my suggestion is to:

* add a label before each button group on the toolbar, "Actions" and "Workflow"
* hide the "More" button if it's unnecessary
* remove the now-unnecessary additional word on the More button.

See the attached screenshots, before and after, prepared with a few tweaks in Firebug. 

(I think we could also improve the spacing around the menu indicator on the More button. In the new design screenshot, it pretty obvious that it has too much space on either side.)
fields.summary: Improve JIRA issue button bar by hiding unnecessary "More" buttons and adding labels for button groups

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Downalod archive version of JIRA 4.4(Mac or Win).Unzip the archive.
2. Launch the config.sh/.bat file.
3. Set the JIRA HOME and save it.
4. Start JIRA.

Result:
1. In the UI, the user never gets the option to select the database type as unknowing when user click save on config tool, it save the database as hsql.
2. In the config tool, the hsql is the default selection in database tab and till now it has not mattered as there was never option to select database in UI.


I discussed it with the Mark and the best option is to add a "none/empty" entry for database.
fields.summary: JIRA config tool is setting up the default database of HSQL when as a user I just wanted to setup JIRA HOME.

fields.description:
Step:
1. UnZip the JIRA 4.4 standalone for windows.
2. Set JIRA HOme and start JIRA using startup.bat file.
3. Setup a new instance of JIRA, enter all details as required in setup screens.
4. Login to JIRA and click on "Administration" link to create project.

Result
1. There is permgen error in logs. Trying to perform any action like create project doesn't work.
2. JIRA is completely unusable.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.4 standalone is throwing a permgen error on startup for a specific Win7 64 bit machine.

fields.description:
The configuration tool produces a {{dbconfig.xml}} XML:

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle10g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:XE</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>bbain</username>
    <password>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</password>
    <pool-size>15</pool-size>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}

In old versions of JIRA we suggested that people needed to add {{SetBigStringTryClob=true}} to their connections settings (e.g http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/5tYB, http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/LQ4aDg). JIRA 4.4 we still suggest this setting if they have see errors (e.g. http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/tQESCw). Rather than waiting for the error to occur in 4.4 why don't we just add the connection property to the Oracle connection for them if there is no ill effects? If the setting is no longer needed (as some people have suggested but we have not verified) when we should remove the note from the documentation.
fields.summary: The JIRA configuration tool and setup wizard does not create the correct Oracle dbconfig.xml

fields.description:
When implementing JRA-23051, I incorrectly placed the warning that there are too many options to be displayed within the results list element without wrapping it in an li element. Whilst this doesn't negatively affect any of our supported browsers, it is syntactically incorrect.

The best solution would be to wrap the notice element in an li in it's render function. However care must be taken to ensure this element is not clickable (as it will become when wrapped in an li).

Another option is to append it after the results list, however due to the way the code works, this element will not be returned as the function only returns the list and it's contents. Any elements appended to it are ignored.
fields.summary: MultiSelect "too many options" suggestion incorrect HTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25238].
  {panel}

The Downloads page for JIRA with OSX recommends:

JIRA 4.4 Standalone (Linux 64 Bit Installer)

but in fact the documentation for OSX at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Mac+OS+X says to use the Standalone version, i.e.

JIRA 4.4 Standalone (TAR.GZ Archive)

As it stands, people are downloading an installer that doesn't work for them. They have to choose "Show All" to get the correct version to download.
fields.summary: Recommended OSX download version for JIRA 4.4 is the wrong one

fields.summary: Ability to create sub-sub tasks

fields.description:
(See [JCLI-178|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/JCLI-178] for a report of this against JCLI).
The JCLI action "removeUser":
- uses SOAP api: deleteUser(token, userId)
- has source: https://bitbucket.org/bob_swift/jira-cli/src/d0d975d4b210/src/main/java/org/swift/jira/cli/JiraUserHelper.java

Given:
- using jira internal directory (embedded Crowd, i.e. tables cwd_user, cwd_membership etc)
- the appropriate constraints are satisfied (user is not reporter, assignee nor project lead)

Result:
- the user is removed from cwd_user
- stray records remain in cwd_membership, check with this query:
{code:sql}SELECT * FROM cwd_membership where not exists (select * from cwd_user where id=child_id){code}
- If later the same user_name is created, it magically appears in the stray groups and cannot be removed from them
-- Jira and JCLI think the operation succeeds, but it has no effect
-- if jira-users is one of these groups, the user can login even before he's officially added to jira-users

Analysis:
- normally there are two relations cwd_user.id=cwd_membership.child_id and cwd_user.user_name=cwd_membership.child_name, but in this case only the latter holds. child_id is in effect a hanging FK without PK
- given JRA-13915, guess it's possible that other stray records are left behind
- IMHO this is also a CWD bug: no matter how called, it should uphold referential integrity
fields.summary: deleteUser leaves stray cwd_membership records

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25234].
  {panel}

Install to Run as Windows Services										
	.shutdown.bat Confluence, JIRA, Crowd									
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\crowd\apache-tomcat\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlCrowdTomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian Crowd								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian Crowd Server - http://localhost:8095/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\crowd\apache-tomcat\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\jira\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlJIRATomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian JIRA Server - http://localhost:8080/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\jira\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	.rc.Edit.C:\8atl\confluence\bin\service.bat 									
		rem Set default Service name								
		set SERVICE_NAME=AtlConfluenceTomcat6								
		set PR_DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian Confluence								
		set PR_DESCRIPTION=Atlassian Confluence Server - http://localhost:8090/								
	.Shift.rc.C:\8atl\confluence\bin.Command Prompt									
		 >service.bat install								
										
	Setup Service dependencies									
		HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Crowd								
			.rc.Edit.DependOnService.Add.postgresql-8.4							
		Repeat for JIRA, Confluence								
			.rc.Edit.DependOnService.Add.AtlCrowdTomcat6							
										
	.Services.Set all to Automatic									
.Restart

fields.description:
The lefthand column lists bugs the current one has been linked to.
The righthand column lists bugs that have been linked to this one.

The descriptions should indicate the difference. Something like:
Left: "This issue is linked to:"
Right: "Linked to this issue"
fields.summary: Both columns in the Links section of a JIRA bug say 'This issue relates to'

fields.description:
This is just one example but I run into weirdnesses like this quite a bit where one search interferes with another.

1. Login to our project and go to JIRA
2. Search 1 -> Search for issues on something that results in several pages of issues
3. Search 2 -> In another tab or browser search on something that displays multiple pages of a different set of issues
4. In the original tab or browser hit the Next or '2' link to get to page 2

Expected: Results 51-100 from Search 1
Actual: Results 51-100 from Search 2

Note: Is it possible/bad if the search criteria is in the URL so it can be copied or saved as favorites instead of having to save every one as filters when may only want them temporarily or don't want to share them? Will create a separate bug if needed.
fields.summary: JIRA search in one tab or browser should not affect searches in other tabs or browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25222].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. For a JIRA instance configured with plugins like GH.
2. Try searching for "General Configuration" or "Licenses"  in JIRA administration quick search dialog.
3. The first result the user gets is for the plugins but most of time I want it for the JIRA.

Expected:
1. From the useability point of view, the first option should be JIRA always and followed by plugins.
fields.summary: Searching for menu operations common across plugin and JIRA in admin quick search always bring plugin options first.
